topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5361b59b6368726a5a230000#post_5361b59b6368726a5a230000
I accidentally ninja'd you, but yeah states that have raised the minimum wage to $10.10/hour actually haven't seen the economy go down like republicans claimed.  In theory it could have negatively effected states, but in practice it didn't.

It just goes to show that there's a difference between theory and practice and that not all the time just cause something says something on paper will it have that effect in real life.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@PaskaNaakka":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5361b496636872380d9a0000#post_5361b496636872380d9a0000
...
I...I can't

So even though he was right, the teacher was telling him to accept a lie and to not do anything about it. "Blatant disregard for authority"? So what this teacher is saying is to do something you know something you know is wrong or accept what you know is wrong just because someone in a position of power said so. Methinks that teacher should be booted from the school, yet because they are teaching kids to be submissive and to take orders, the teacher would if anything get promoted.

Anyway, this is now the stupid thread, post more stuff like this. It's too fascinating to ignore.
